pr_title: Fix custom, oauth and authz-keycloak related P12 truststore are not built correctly

timeline.message:
Fix for P12 truststore generation for listeners custom certificates

Signed-off-by: Paolo Patierno <ppatierno@live.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need the regex? Is the prefix not enough? This is something what just ties it too much to changes in other places.
timeline.author: scholzj

-fi
+regex="^\/opt\/kafka\/certificates\/custom-([a-z0-9]{1,11})-([0-9]+)-certs$"

replies.bodyText:
I am going to use it to be more general with the oauth related certificates as well.
I am testing my changes to update the PR.
replies.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: I do not think you addresses my main point. I think having the regex too exact is a risk because if we change for whatever reason the rules for port names we would need to do it on multiple places. So I wonder if using something more general for example such as ^\/opt\/kafka\/certificates\/(custom|oauth)-(.*+)-(.*+)-certs$ wouldn't work equally well with less dependency on the Java code.
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText:
wouldn't work equally well with less dependency on the Java code

So I am confused, is the above statement missing a question mark? Are you suggesting to use the more general grouping or not?
replies.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: Yeah, there is missing question mark, sorry ... I think more general would be better.
